column1: In assessment there is no plagarism, but commusion upheld the allegation that there is a plagiarism.
I did not see the  why the allegation is upheld
Probably commision did not read my assessment
The content of my Paper includes only the content of the task
The commission was suggesting only by plagiarism system outcome
I consider that the plagiarism system outcome is wrong
The content of my Paper did not refer to any book, an article and any Other people work
There is no Source that I could plagiaryzm, because it consists only a task content
﻿Well, I did not include the fact that I nonconfirm the plagiarism system outcome
I consider the plagiarism system wrong marked the file
because the file include only the content of the task
As my defend to The commission, I wrote them I just Submitted a wrong file
I suggested that in the files was some notes but I meant the content of the task - I did not specify what note - there is no even notes.
If the commission consider that I commit the plagiarism, then from which source if I did not commit plagiarism

OFFICAL ARGUMENT FOR THE REASON 1: There is new and relevant evidence that you were demonstrably and for the most exceptional reasons unable to present to the Secretary to Academic Board or Academic Misconduct Officer or to the Panel of Investigation meeting during the Academic Misconduct investigation;

You must be able to present a case to show why it would have been unreasonable for the University to expect you to disclose the evidence at an earlier stage, ie, when you had the opportunity to respond to the allegation of academic misconduct or, if the circumstances were known to you, why you chose not to disclose them at the time.
﻿ This is a good one as well, but careful

OFFICAL ARGUMENT FOR THE REASON 2: That the Academic Integrity and Misconduct procedures were not complied with in such a way that it might cause reasonable doubt as to whether the result would have been different had they been complied with.
You must indicate which procedures were not followed and why you think that the decision would have been different if they had been followed
﻿ (this is a quite a good one)
The information that you provide with the appeal will be referred back to the Academic Misconduct Office and the case will be reconsidered in the light of the new information.
OUTCOME :What are the possible outcomes from a Justified (successful) appeal based on Student Academic Misconduct?

The Academic Misconduct Officer will contact you in due course about what action is to be taken.  This might include holding an Academic Misconduct Hearing where you would have the opportunity to present your case to a Panel
Take into account the legacy reason
﻿What are the MDX legacy reason in this case
That there is documented evidence of prejudice or bias on the part of the Secretary to Academic Board or by one or more members of the Panel of Investigation.
That the penalty imposed exceeds the maximum penalties listed in the regulations
This is an evidence error that is both relevant and significant to the decision by the Assessment Board in respect of your award or progression
You must therefore be able to present a case to show that an error has been made, and the effect it has had on the Assessment Board’s decision
"This is my appeal from the decision of the Secretary to Academic Board in the matter of Allegation of Academic misconduct of Module MGT4544 (Assessment 1 & Assessment 3 – August submissions)."

"I appeal because I consider there is new and relevant evidence that I did not to present to the Secretary to Academic Board or Academic Misconduct Officer or to the Panel of Investigation meeting during the Academic Misconduct investigation and that the Academic Integrity and Misconduct procedures were not complied with in such a way that it might cause reasonable doubt as to whether the result would have been different had they been complied with."

There is new and relevant evidences that I did not present properly the Academic Misconduct Officer.  The evidences prove  that the assignment workpaper  that I   sent donotr  include work of  other people then  so plagiarism.

To submit an appeal, complete and submit the Academic Appeal Form below.

There is no need to discuss your case with members of staff before submitting your appeal.  You should submit your appeal within 10 working days of the date of the written outcome to your misconduct case.

The second evidence present my assignment work  paper which I sent wirht before deadline. I affirm these files are same that I sent to MyLearning file where plagiarism  system pointed out that my work papers include 90% of plagiarism.
Case 2: The  content of the file (except first pages included data)  is same like  the  content of the assignment (task)
Evidence 2: The assignment that I sent
The new Evidences I did  not presented to the Academic Misconduct Office:
The last evidence is assignment file from the module which indlude  the  concent of the task.

OFFICAL ARGUMENT FOR THE REASON 1: There is new and relevant evidence that you were demonstrably and for the most exceptional reasons unable to present to the Secretary to Academic Board or Academic Misconduct Officer or to the Panel of Investigation meeting during the Academic Misconduct investigation;
Case 3: The content of the file do  not include a work of aother people
Evidence 3: The task files with the task content

In a sum of documents I meantioned above I consider that after compering my paper work  files  and  module assignment files, it easy  to discover that  my  paper include  only content of  the module assignment tasks except my my data and  pattern. Thus, we can assume that the plagiarism system discovered online the module assignemnt paper in  the university  resources  and  maked it as a content of work of other people. But, I did not use work  of other people, I just prepered  pattern for writting with content of the task  to  know how to write  and  what to do the  assignment properly. I sent the my pattern paper as my work paper by mistake and  because i sent it right before thedeadline, then I was unable  to fix it.
To submit an appeal, complete and submit the Academic Appeal Form below.

There is no need to discuss your case with members of staff before submitting your appeal.  You should submit your appeal within 10 working days of the date of the written outcome to your misconduct case.

You must be able to present a case to show why it would have been unreasonable for the University to expect you to disclose the evidence at an earlier stage, ie, when you had the opportunity to respond to the allegation of academic misconduct or, if the circumstances were known to you, why you chose not to disclose them at the time.
I was  sure, that the investigation officer will check my file is there real plagiatism, while I  indicate there was just notes.

I did  not  cleary  presented in the earier stage of the  investigation because I was  sure that my argumentation will coax  the Accademic Misconduct Panel to check  and  verify my workpaper is there really plagiarism..

OFFICAL ARGUMENT FOR THE REASON 2: That the Academic Integrity and Misconduct procedures were not complied with in such a way that it might cause reasonable doubt as to whether the result would have been different had they been complied with.

Procedure:  the commision did not check if there is plagarism  while I indicate there was  note and wrong file. The plagiarism system  detect plagiarism while  there is only the constent of the  module assignement file.

If the commision  could   check manually there is plagiarism, they could  see that  the plagiarism system was wrong and there is no plagiarism  and the plagiarism system was wrong because of  the reasons I mentioned  above.
You must indicate which procedures were not followed and why you think that the decision would have been different if they had been followed
What could be different if the procedure was fallowed:

In a sum of argumentation  and  evidenves that I encapsulate above  arise that I did not  perpetrate plagiarism and I assure I could not do this. As well as i assume there is no evidence that I perpetrate plagiarism becouse my papaers work include  only the content of module  assignemnt paper, and having included  this in the paper work is not a plagiarism. obciously I  could not use content of the  task as my work. Thus, i assume penalize  me for stealing of work someone is unfounded.
Ifthere was stole  work of  someone, then  from whom?
Why the decition  should be canceled

However, I should better pointed out  my  argumentation on  the earier stage of the investigation as  well as better and   loser lookat thestudent regulation, and react earier. Also i should ensure what I am sending to MyLearning page.
I learned that I should better care  about what  I am sending  and  always be better  prepered.
﻿ What I learned from the mistakes
I really want to continue my education at Middlesex  University and I am sorry for  the problem and  my mistakes. I hope  the result of this investigation will  be positive for me.

Technika polegająca na szybkim i krótkookresowym wypozyjonowaniu serwisu w Google. Ze względu na większe ryzyko wykrycia wykonywanych czynności przez algorytm Google pozycjonowana w ten sposób strona może zostać na stałe usunięta z indeksu.

Główny cel to odpowiednia optymalizacja treści pod wymogi wyszukiwarki
Google śledzi, czy użytkownik długo zostaje na stronie i jeśli szybko puści to wpłynie negatywnie na popularność strony domeny
Stąd użytkownik powinien znajdować na stronie tego czego szuka oraz tego czego oczekuję po kliknięciu w Google
Wiąże się to z odpowiednim przygotowaniem treści pod użytkowników
Głównym tego celem jest zatrzymanie użytkownika jak najdłużej
natomiast jeżeli użytkownik długo zostanie na stronie to wpłynie to pozytywnie na indyk z Google i również popularność domeny
Wiąże się również to z odpowiednim przygotowaniem treści pod roboty wyszukiwarki
Zwiększanie pozycji w wyszukiwarce jeśli robot pozytywnie oceni treść strony

Techniki pozycjonowania akceptowalne przez Google. Głównym ich celem jest odpowiednia optymalizacja serwisu pod wymogi wyszukiwarki i przygotowanie treści zrozumiałej zarówno dla użytkownika, jak i dla robotów indeksujących.

Bitmapa nazywana również bitmapą indeksową lub tablicą bitów, jest mapowaniem z jednego z systemów jak na przykład z liczb całkowity na bity. Pamięć podzielona jest na jednostki bitmapy, które mają ważą od kilku bajtów do kilku kilobajtów. Każda jednostka pamięci jest przydzielana do bita w bitmapie. Jeśli jednostka pamięci jest zajęta, to bit wynosi jeden, natomiast jeśli jest pusta to bit wynosi zero. Bitmapa przydaje się, by w dość prosty sposób, śledzić rozmieszczenie pamięci przy niewielkim zużyciu pamięci. Rozmiar bitmapy jest zależna tylko od rozmiaru pamięci oraz jednostek.

﻿ linki pozycjonujące prowadzące do strony kanonicznej

"Jednym z najbardziej istotnych czynników rankingowych są linki pozycjonujące, prowadzące do twojej witryny. Wpływają one w znaczny sposób na przepisywanie przez wyszukiwarkę poszczególnych frazą pozycji, które zajmują wśród wyników wyszukiwania. "

"Blogowanie jest doskonalą receptą na brak odpowiedniego ruchu do strony pochodzącego z wyników organicznych (SERP-ów)", co najczęściej ma miejsce w przypadku nowych stron i świeżo założonych sklepów internetowych"
